Reviews.Title: “Average hotel at a great value for money”
Reviews.Author: marcnicolas
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights at the nh Berlin City West during a short trip to Berlin in December. All in all the hotel is average. Nothing more and nothing less. The service at the reception was okay, as was the room. I stayed in a single room which was equipped with all necessities and nothing more. The bathroom was clean but really tiny. The doors and floor carpeting in the hallways looked cheap. The fitness room is let's say "not well equipped". The bar is small aswell. It would be quite nice if the breakfast tables could be used as a "Bar extension" as soon as the lobby bar is full. If it comes to location, the hotel is a bit off the centre but the public transport is quite close. The plus side of the hotel is the pricing. If you need a clean bed to sleep and have no need for anything fancy you might consider this hotel for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst In the World Advice you never try it and loss your money and time”
Reviews.Author: Luaysaffar
Reviews.Content: I have booked through Expedia at NH Berlin West,Berlin 3 rooms from 13-12-2011 until 17-12-2011 total 4 nights when we arrived to this hotel we found it like a ghost house the hotel was empty ,Eclectic power problem ,Hotel lobby sealing leaking water,Carpet damage and wet,Restaurant closed tables and chairs were upside down we were shocked to see the hotel which Expedia offer to us in this condition,we asked them to transfer our booking to any other NH hotel in the city they refused because other hotels will not accept that so that we didnt get our rooms because its impossible for us to stay in such hotel with roof and sealing leaking and dirty so that we went to other NH hotel near Charlie check point and pay 129 euro /Night for each room and stay their during our trip. Location also is the worst in Berlin Far from every thing and 8 KM far from the center which will cost you 14 Euro by Taxi for each trip to the Center Sirs Its a shame to Expedia Also to deal with such damage hotel without informing the clients about it and let us loss money and time which such bad offer from Expedia which we trust always but starting from now we have to think 1000 time before we chose Expedia again . I hope that some one at Expedia will read this message and bother him self to check about this Mass which happened to us just because we trust Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “A solid 3 stars hotel, definitely does not deserve a 4 stars rating”
Reviews.Author: kurtzuegg
Reviews.Content: Not ideally located, but nevertheless not too far away from the city center, I have found this hotel rather disappointing for a 4 star. I had a room on the top floor which has the advantage of having a small balcony with a great view on the city. The room was clean and rather nice, even though the furniture and fittings are quite spartan. Personnel at the reception desk is nice but beware of the waiters at the bar, which I have found to be very unfriendly and unpleasant. Couldn't take advantage of the buffet breakfast, which looked quite nice, nor of any other hotel amenity (not that there is much else, really). If this hotel was classed as a 3 start I would have given it a 4 rating here on TripAdvisor.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: mosi_10
Reviews.Content: Having read bad reviews i was quite dubious about staying here. I initially booked for one night only just in case. This was perfect for us. Train ticket 3.65E (short bus hop to nearest tube stop and no changes) brought us right to the door of the hotel. Check in not allowed til after 3pm but they kept our cases in a locked lobby area. Large room - we requested one at the back because of mentions of noise). We slept very well. Kitchen areas are now empty - now a closed little room off the main bedroom. Two large single beds. One large sofa and coffee table with a small fridge. We walked into KuDam strasse for shopping daily (15 mins). We used underground for longer trips (right outside). Had breakfast outside the hotel. Internet cafe a few doors down towards the metro station. Good beer/G&T in bar for a nightcap. Would definitely stay again. 3 lifts worked perfectly. No noise. Downside: Check in is slow, no aircon, a little tatty on corridoor.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast for a 4 star!”
Reviews.Author: Bunal
Reviews.Content: There is a metro station enterence 50m away from hotel. As travelling with metro & bus network is very easy & cheat in Berlin, it makes easy to go everywhere from the hotel. The rooms were clean, quiet, the reception employees were very helpful. And the best thing about the hotel for me was the great open buffet breakfast. There were a wide variety of cheese & breads, yogurts, egg, cold & hot drinks etc.

Reviews.Title: “Could do Better .... A lot better”
Reviews.Author: summerhouse2
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the staff are extremely friendly and accommodating. A call to reception requesting something would see it brought to the room within minutes. The room was more like an apartment with living room, double bedroom, small kitchen with fridge and cooker, but with no crockery, cutlery untensils etc, and a bathroom. The bathroom was very clean but on the whole the apartment was a little shabbyand tired, with grubby paintwork, and walls. The bed was comfortable although had two single duvets on a zip together mattress. The living room had a round table with four chairs two faux leather chairs and a sofa bed. TV with only two English channels both news. It was not too noisy but I was on the 5th floor. Breakfast was not included in my room rate and is charged extra at €17.00. This is over priced by about double. It is the usual buffet style serve yourself with a selection of cold meats, cheeses, cereals and pastries and bread. The hot alternative is poor quality produce and poorly cooked. e.g. only scrambled egg offered and it had to be SLICED! If I stayed again, which I might, I'd have my breakfast elsewhere. The coffee however was very good and plentiful. My other major criticism was WiFi or internet connection. Business package cost €5.95 per hour or €17.95 per 24hours or €75.00 for seven days. An economy alternative started at €10.95 (24hrs) but was much truncated. This is a rip off and would discourage me as a business traveller, after all I am out most of the day and only really need WiFi early evening and first thing in the morning. I think €5.95 per 24 hours would be a fairer price, or make it 24 hours during the stay not a 24 hour period. The standard of the hotel was adequate to a point apart from the aforementioned, it was in a good area, but if it was aiming at the business traveller or budget traveller, Premier Inn it ain't.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Brightonian
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was in a residential area very close to U Bahn Berliner Str with connections to DB Train stations. I was flying into Schonefeld and attending and exhibition at Messe/ICC so this was convenient for both. Room was spacious & clean with all requirements including mini-bar, toiletries, mineral water etc. I spent some time working in my room and the Internet access was, I felt rather pricey at €17 for 24hrs. I didnt use the bar or room service but had a very nice and cheap Pizza from the restaurant across the road!

Reviews.Title: “Slightly dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: cpjk
Reviews.Content: We booked a weekend trip to Berlin and decided to stay at NH Berlin City West. The information on various websites stated that the hotel is located within walking distance of the Kurfurstendamm, which is one of the main reasons for choosing this hotel. Unfortuantely the information turned out to be incorrect, as it was at least a 20 minute walk to the shopping streets. The hotel itself is fine, the receptionists were very friendly, rooms were clean and quite large.

Reviews.Title: “Good all round hotel”
Reviews.Author: infast
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine. Rooms spacious, staff friendly and good location for access to all of Berlin using the underground system. Breakfast was good selection of hot and cold. One complaint: no air conditioning in room and during July the room got very warm. Because of its location when you opened the windows for ventilation the early morning traffic noise was VERY LOUD.

Reviews.Title: “A nice and clean hotel with some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: Natallia10
Reviews.Content: What I did not like in this hotel - the bed. "Double-bed" was just two single beds put together. They tended to move apart every second one moves. I did not have breakfast, for my opinion, it is too expensive there (around 16 euro per person). For this price one can have a good meal in Berlin. 100-200 meters from the hotel were some nice places to have breakfast for a half of this price. The hotel was nice and clean, a bit overpriced though. It fits good for a business trip, but for a romantic trip one has to choose something different :(

Reviews.Title: “Very good room - far from turism spots”
Reviews.Author: Lirio-Brasil
Reviews.Content: Room was very good, but no air-conditioning. Amenities were good, breakfast was good. Location is the negative point about this hotel. It is far from the main turistic spots in the city. Staff was nice.

Reviews.Title: “How can I say this... smelly?”
Reviews.Author: Anna0270
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a double room with my husband. As soon as we opened the door we could tell a bad smell, and when we opened the bathroom door...it was like a public toilet, another couple friend of us told us they had seen urine marks on the W.C . And it´s a pity ´cause the room looks quite nice, spacious and ordered. Another low point is the bed... the matresses are really bad, not firm at all, if you have back problems I suggest you look for another hotel. Internet is not for free, well, there´s ONE computer which can be used for 15 minutes for free. I think that no matter how near to the U-Bahn it is, how big the rooms are...with these low points I wouldn´t recommend it at all. Ah! there´s a hall in the hotel you have to walk through in order to get to the parking place, and that´s really smelly !

Reviews.Title: “Eww...bugs”
Reviews.Author: Man_U_canuck
Reviews.Content: Thought it would be nice to stay in a hotel appox 10 mins away from the shopping area. Looked so much like a business hotel, but you have to pay 17 euro to get onto internet. Rip off IMO. Got a room on the first floor, with the parking lot view. Basically someone could've just break the glass and climb in, very unsecured. Saw 3 spiders in the room, called the receptionist to get someone up and deal with it. He didn't quite know what 'bugs' or 'insects' are. Good thing he speaks Cantonese and finally I've got him to come up and get those killed. Bathroom is just too small. That standing shower design is plain stupid, how could you stop water leaking out with curtains but not doors! Asked for room service, he actually told me they've got tomato soup availbale only - not interested. That being said, the breakfast variety impressed me a lot. It's just like a lunch buffet. WOW!

Reviews.Title: “Dull area of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Svein
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night here, but had to move up to Kurfurstendam to find any interesting spots. The area where this hotel is located, miss everything. The hotel itself showed it was a refurbished old hotel, and the furniture was nice, but the whole hotel and area lacked athmospfere. Would only stay here again for the low price offered € 65 double no breakfast. U-bahn stop is just 200 metres away, but it took one hour to get to Schoenefeld airport. 3 - 4 stops to city center. Get a room on the backside, as there is much traffic noise on the entrance side. Saw some people there for breakfast, the day before I had the feeling we were the only ones in the hotel, and therefor got a large corner room. Comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: madcow1976
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had booked a standard double room, which was a good size, and it also had a separate dressing room. Bathroom had a bath and separate shower. We knew before we arrived that most of the rooms had no air-con, but we arrived during a heatwave! After spending two nights melting in our room, we asked at reception if any rooms had air-con. We were told that the only rooms with this were on the 8th floor where the business suites were. Luckily there was one free, and we were charged an extra 10 euros each per night to upgrade. Although the new room was smaller than the original, and not one of the suites, it was well worth it to have a lovely cool room for the rest of the week. We also had to ask for a kettle as there wasn't one in any of the rooms, and it was brought to us the next day. Although they didn't give me a cup or tea bags, I bought them cheaply locally. Any other time of year, we would have been happy with our original room, and we would recommend the hotel. The staff speak good English, and are very helpful. Reception is manned 24 hours. As we stayed on room-only basis I don't know what breakfast is like. It has a good location next to the U-bahn at Berliner Strasse, only 3 stops from Ku'Damm and 4 from Zoo. We stayed in another hotel down the road at Prager Platz last year, and love this area as it is quiet but really close to town. Lots of supermarkets, shops and restaurants are all close by.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite there yet”
Reviews.Author: mattp1874
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. It was ok but it is missing the finer touches that the chain is trying to achieve. The bar / lobby was very nice, fairly modern and up todate. My friends checked in early and got the smallest room I have ever seen. When I checked in got an upgrade to a suite, which nice was still not quite what you expect. The living area was ok, but the TV was old fashioned and the remote did not work well. The kitchen area (which I didnt use) had a cooker which was about 30 years old. The bed room, had a bed and a chest of drawers, no TV, no phone which is what I really want in my room, as I dont want to watch TV in the living area all the time. The bathroom was clean, but you were only given 1 towel !! and the hot water was controlled by a boiler on the wall, even when it was turned up as high as it could go, the shower could only be described as warm. So not too bad, but very much a 2 star type of accomadtion and not the higher standard the marketing material seems to make these hotels in to.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable but very petite”
Reviews.Author: Nitus
Reviews.Content: Having had a one night stay in the Artus Hotel in Berlin, it has not been too hard to leave. The hotel was clean. The staff had been very friendly and exceptionally helpfull, especially in explaining directions. Anyhow I was upset about the size of my single room. Although the bed met my expectations as a standard German single bed (a lot smaller than an American queen sized bed), there has barely been space to leave my suitcase in the room. Even worse the bathroom was so small that I had to pay attention not to bump here and there all the time. Since I was travelling with a couple, I was able to see their room. Their double room consisted of a living room and a separate bed room. Both very spacious. Anyhow my as well as their room were lacking atmosphere and nice furniture. Positively I remember the central location and the huge breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: amazingthing
Reviews.Content: I first read the reviews on this side and when booking, I've asked for a quiet double room and got one far away from the main road, so no noise at all. It was actually a little suite; the bedroom was separate from the living room and we got a kitchenette as well for €74 per room and night which is compared to other 4* hotels in Berlin quite cheap. I have to admit that the hotel is a bit off the track but just some steps from the next metro station which takes you in a few stops to the famous Kurfürstendamm or Railwaystation Zoo. The hotel staff is very helpful. Would definetly book my next Berlin stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A very decent hotel in West Berlin.”
Reviews.Author: BerlinerPooh
Reviews.Content: The rooms are adequate but a little on the drab side and very noisy from the main street in front. The kitchenette had been removed so we used the area for storing luggage and all the shopping. There is an underground just up the road and another across the street. It takes no time at all to reach the fabulous shops, restaurants and busy area of the Ku'Damm. The main entrance to the hotel is rather grand and adjacent to a large cafeteria/bar area. The breakfasts were worth getting up for! The staff were very friendly and recommended a little Italian restaurant 5 minutes away which served the best pizzas ever ... needless to say we went back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Artus”
Reviews.Author: Clara79
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a bit of a surprise as we could not find any reviews anywhere. However, it turned out to be an entirely pleasant one! The location is great, close to Ku-Damn and Charlottenburg and literally next to the Berliner Strasse U-Bahn. The staff were excellent willing to help a bunch of english with directions, good restaurants and clubs at all hours! The rooms were HUGE- we expected a bedroom and a bathroom and got both these and a luxurious lounge and a little kitchen! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone as we paid less than £75 for a twin room- it's just a pity we could not stay any longer to appreciate Berlin and this great hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: NH Berlin City West
HotelInfo.Address: Bundesallee 36/37, 10717 Berlin, Germany
